titlestmt.titleproper: Bryn Mawr College Graduate School of Social Work and Social Research records 1949-1980 1960-1980
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Bryn Mawr College Graduate School of Social Work and Social Research records

bioghist.p: Bryn Mawr College's Graduate School of Social Work and Social Research was founded in 1915 as the Graduate Department of Social Economy and Social Research. Students spend a substantial portion of their time doing field work, supplemented with classroom study in casework, public welfare and legislation, and research and social investigation. The school offers three degree programs: Master of Social Service (MSS); Master of Law and Social Policy (MLSP); and Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.).

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of course files and case presentations (1949-1980) from the Bryn Mawr Graduate School of Social Work and Social Research. Records include: bibliographies and syllabi for courses; minutes of faculty meetings; case presentations for Social Casework II, III, and IV; and class schedules.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Bryn Mawr College: Susan M. Kingsbury papers, Bernard Ross papers, and Mildred Fairchild Woodbury papers.
